   America's Health Insurance Plans
   stated on August 27, 2009 in CNN's Lou Dobbs Tonight:
   "Every survey shows strong satisfaction with private coverage."
Every survey shows strong satisfaction with private coverage.

Between 2001 and 2008, 20 to 28 percent of respondents rated
   their health care coverage "excellent" while between 39 and 51 percent
   rated their coverage "good."

So, recent surveys generally indicate that Americans are satisfied with
   their current coverage, although it's not always the "strong satisfaction"
   that Tuffin claimed, especially in the Gallup data, in which "good"
   outpaces "excellent" by roughly 2-to-1.
